content.description: Thin moves climb up for a short balancy crux.  Short, sweet, and steep.  Good distraction when you bring the noobs out for the moderate lines.
content.location: About 200 feet left of the primary landing.  Trail is scarce, but the landings are good.

content.description: Too Easy but a good climb for the rating.  A great place to introduce the novice to climbing.  Great pockets down low lead up to a couple of ledges with easy moves in between.   Trashy mid-wall ledge makes a helmet advisable.  The first 30 feet is the crux section great footholds with some thin crimps and a few very sharp pockets that are great for clipping.  Above the ledge the climbing is more 5.easy.  Rapping off is advisable as the rope drag over the sharp abrasive ledge will be harh on the sheath of your rope.
content.location: Just left of Frosted Flakes, on the primary wall.

content.description: Just like Oatmeal, working the wall about 10 feet further down the wall.  A good climb for the rating. Trashy mid-wall ledge makes a helmet advisable.  The first 30 feet is the crux section great footholds with some thin crimps for a 5.5.  Above the ledge the climbing is more 5.easy.
content.location: Second route left of Frosted Flakes.

content.description: Climb up on good pockets.  The crux is right at the bulge, the sequence is essential for sending this line.  A good route that sort of reminds me of Revenge of the Little Fingers over at Tornado.
content.location: About 100 yards down the wall from Frosted Flakes.  Look for the cleared landing with a decent, but overgrown trail.

content.description: Easy moves up to the ledge with lots of foot hand hand matches and mantles.  Good pockets past two more bolts to reach a corner where Follow the big flakes with excellent footholds on the opposing positioning the body left of the crack makes laying back the flakes a breeze.  The 'X'ed rock is gone now, the crack go clean and smooth all the way to the easy clip at the chains.  My favorite easy warmup.  A classic 5.7, easy 4-star!
content.location: Climb the flakes in the obvious corner.

content.description: The best 5.10 in the canyon!  Excellent movement with pair of cruxes once you start up the steep section.  A rest between them allows a good recovery.  The holds up top can get dusty as the climbing isn't as fluid as down low.
content.location: First route on the wall.  Rightmost.  Shares start with Frosted Flakes, follows the line of bolts to the right.

content.description: Climb up on good pockets and ledges.  Easier line works off to the right as it rises.  The sustained direct line flows far better.
content.location: On the far left side of the main wall.  25 feet to the left of #4.

content.description:
This wall currently only has a handful of moderate routes, but the potential for new lines, should the bolting ban currently in effect be lifted, is immense. 

  The wall faces east, and features a wide variety of terrain, from low angle slabs to overhanging caves.
